intro: Mentha pallida, commonly known as pale mint, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a light green color. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple, appearing in whorled clusters. Pale mint is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
